Method Detail

isAllowAllRoles

public boolean isAllowAllRoles()
Are all state roles allowed to use this transition?

Returns:
true if they are, false otherwise.

setAllowAllRoles

public void setAllowAllRoles(boolean allowAll)
Set if all state roles are allowed to use this transition.

Parameters:
allowAll - true if they are, false if a list of transition roles is to be specified (see getTransitionRoles())

Parameters:
number - The number of approvals.

getRequiresComment

public PSTransition.PSWorkflowCommentEnum getRequiresComment()
Get the comment requirements for this workflow.

Returns:
the comment requirement for this transition, never null.

setRequiresComment

public void setRequiresComment(PSTransition.PSWorkflowCommentEnum requirement)
Set the comment requirements for this workflow.

Parameters:
requirement - The comment requirement, may not be null.

isDefaultTransition

public boolean isDefaultTransition()
Is this the default transition for the from state?

Returns:
true if it is, false otherwise.

setDefaultTransition

public void setDefaultTransition(boolean isDefault)
Set if this is the default transition for the from state.

Parameters:
isDefault - true if it is the default, false if not.

getTransitionRoles

public List<PSTransitionRole> getTransitionRoles()
Get the roles allowed to use this transition. Is only used if isAllowAllRoles() returns false.

Returns:
a list with all allowed roles which may use this transition, never null, may be empty.

setTransitionRoles

public void setTransitionRoles(List<PSTransitionRole> roleList)
Set toles roles allowed to use this transition. Is only used if isAllowAllRoles() returns false.

Parameters:
roleList - The list of roles, may be null or empty.

fromXML

public void fromXML(String xmlsource)
             throws IOException,
                    SAXException
Description copied from interface: IPSCatalogItem
Restore the given item from an XML description. The implementation of this is up to the class in question. It is acceptable to use the JavaBean APIs to accomplish this.

Parameters:
xmlsource - the string that represents this item, never null or empty
Throws:
IOException - if there is a problem reading the xml source
SAXException - if there is a problem parsing the xml source

toXML

public String toXML()
             throws IOException,
                    SAXException
Description copied from interface: IPSCatalogItem
Serialize the information in the item into XML format. The implementation of this is up to the class in question. It is acceptable to use the JavaBean APIs to accomplish this.

Returns:
a string containing the XML that represents the item. This information must contain the items guid, but is not required to hold the type information.
Throws:
IOException - if there is a problem serializing the object
SAXException - if there is an issue converting the object to XML
